summary: Diff implements improved frontend error normalization/toasts for entry creation and adds React Query invalidation/refetch so Entries and Dashboard update after saving. Backend shows a role assignment on registerUser, but there’s no clear evidence of automatic/robust user-role initialization for all authenticated callers across the required endpoints.

missing_requirements.requirement: Update backend access control initialization so authenticated users are reliably granted the required 'user' permissions to use core app functionality without needing an admin secret token.
missing_requirements.reason: The diff only shows role assignment during registerUser; it does not show any initialization/auto-assignment path ensuring a newly signed-in principal can call getCallerUserProfile, saveCallerUserProfile, addOrUpdateEntry, getEntries, and getDashboard without hitting authorization traps due to missing role initialization. No migration/init logic beyond registerUser is evidenced.
evidence: backend/main.mo (shows `registerUser` assigning `#user`, but no broader initialization is shown)
